page.title: 15THE CATHOLIC CHURCH BURWASH
page.content: At the end of the village there is a Catholic Church and compared to St. Bartholomew's it is small and doesn't have a tower, the roof is shaped like an oval and there is a cross you can see as you walk along the pathway. At the back of the church there is a stained glass window of Jesus. Inside the church the altar is made of stone, it has a carved cross at the front and a candle at each end of the altar table. There is a Hymn Board that tells you where to look in your hymn book and an organ to play the music for the hymns. On Friday evenings lots of the children come to the church to learn the Catechism, we sing songs and then we finish with a prayer. I go to church every Sunday with Stephanie, Philip, Francis and Mum it is a lovely service.
